{"step_by_step_thinking": "Granulation tissue is a type of tissue that forms during the healing process of a wound. It is composed of new connective tissue and tiny blood vessels. The main type of collagen found in granulation tissue is Type 3 collagen. This type of collagen is also known as reticulin and is found in reticular fibers, which are part of the extracellular matrix that supports the tissue's structure.", "answer_choice": "C. Type 3"}
